Try playing a card by dragging it on one of the empty spaces on the board.
 
 Any card in your hand that has a green highlight can be played.
Rush cards cannot attack players on the turn they're played
When a new player uses your username as their referral code they will receive 1 rare pack and you will receive a rare pack every time they level up their account
When you are done with your turn. Click on End Turn
You must play at least one match every 24 hours to keep reward earnings active. Rewards pause until you play again.
YOUR DECK HAS BEEN SAVED AND CAN BE USED IN BATTLE.
YOUR GAME VERSION {0} IS OUT OF DATE. LATEST VERSION IS {1}.

Welcome to Fracctal TCG Beta!
 Let's learn a bit about the game.

In Adventure mode, you learn the basics of the game as well as the different types of cards and abilities.
 
 You also earn rewards as you defeat challenges!
In Practice mode you can test your different decks, complete missions, and learn the game without affecting your ranking.

Battle against other players in Ranked Multiplayer.
 
 You can check your PvP ranking using the button at the top of the nav bar.

Compete in daily automated tournaments against other players in our Tournament mode.
 
 Win Essence currency, account XP, packs, and guild points in these competitions!

Missions are the primary method of gaining currency to open new packs.
 
 There are many more features like match spectating, daily login streak rewards, friends list, player-created guilds, battle pass rewards, and much more!
 
 We suggest you start with Adventure mode. Good luck!
Great job! Creatures that just entered play cannot attack in the same turn.
Your goal is to reduce your opponent's HP to 0.
Many monsters are quite strong because their Fury ability lets them attack twice per turn!
You will probably want to get rid of the Ignitus this turn, otherwise it could damage a lot of your HP!
Your Jagur can only deal 1 damage, but you need 2 to destroy the Ignitus.
You have two choices. You can either try to paralyze the Ignitus, or play a Cheetula to boost your Jagur's attack.
Great choice, the Ignitus won't be able to attack for the next 2 turns.
Now you could attack the opponent, or end your turn.
Great choice, now your Jagur has 2 attack. You can attack and kill the Ignitus!
To attack the opponent's HP. Drag one of your characters in play on top of the opponent's hand area.

Your hand is fullyou can't hold more than {0} cards. Play or discard cards to draw more.

{0} just evolved! Characters evolve after they survive {1} of your turns on the board. If the evolved form is still on the board, its On Play ability triggers again, and any negative status effects are removed first.
Choose a token to see redeemable cards.

The Electric Fairy lets you spend {0} element points to target one of your Electric monsters on the board and give it Haste.

In short, the Electric Fairy supercharges your Electric teambreaking the usual limits of a turn and letting them strike early with Haste.

The Fire Fairy lets you spend {0} element points to target any active card on the board or either player and deal 1 damage to that target.

This gives you flexibility in how you use it:
Target an enemy monster to chip away at its health or finish it off.
Target your opponent directly to push their life total lower.

The Ice Fairy lets you target any active card on the board and freeze it for 1 turn at the cost of {0} element points.

When a card is frozen, it cannot take actions on its next turn. This makes the Ice Fairy especially useful.

In short, the Ice Fairy is a tool of controlable to stall dangerous threats, even those normally resistant to spells.

The Plant Fairy lets you spend {0} element points to heal any card on the board or either player for 2 health.

This makes the Plant Fairy a versatile support tool.

In short, the Plant Fairy brings balance to your strategyrestoring health where it's most needed.
The Psychic Fairy lets you spend {0} elemental points to force the opponent to discard a card from their hand.

The Rock Fairy lets you spend {0} element points to grant 1 Armor to any character.

Armor reduces incoming damage from other characters by the amount of armor applied.

Armor is permanent and does not break when absorbing damage.

In short, the Rock Fairy provides lasting protectionmaking your characters harder to kill unless the opponent finds a way to Silence them.

The Shadow Fairy lets you spend {0} element points to target any card on the board and place a Curse on it.

A cursed character's Attack is reduced by 1 at the start of each turn.

In short, the Shadow Fairy steadily drains the power of your opponent's forces, weakening them turn by turn until they can no longer fight back.

The Water Fairy lets you spend {0} element points to draw 1 card from your deck.

Use it when your hand is running low, or when you're searching for a specific card to complete your strategy.

In short, the Water Fairy gives you a steady flow of resources, keeping your deck moving and your options open.

Games usually start without any board cards on the field, but to guide you through the adventure tutorial {0} is here to help!
Games usually start without any board cards on the field, but to guide you through the adventure tutorial {0} are here to help!

Locations are powerful artifacts that grant lasting bonuses. You must play them in the Location slot to the left of your normal board slots, and only one Location can be active on your side at a time.
